original_solution_mapping.L1: At the end of his first week, Brian now has doubled his initial time of 10 seconds to 10*2=<<10*2=20>>20 seconds
original_solution_mapping.L2: At the end of his second week, Brian doubled the previous week's time of 20 seconds to 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 seconds
original_solution_mapping.L3: At the end of his third week of practice, Brian adds another 50% of 40 seconds to his time so 40*.5= <<40*.5=20>>20 seconds added
original_solution_mapping.L4: Having added 20 seconds to his time from his second week, Brian can now hold his breath for 40+20= <<20+40=60>>60 seconds

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 348.
    Returns: how long Brian can hold his breath for now.
    """
    # L1
    initial_breath_hold_time = 10 # 10 seconds
    doubling_factor = 2 # doubled the amount of time
    first_week_time = initial_breath_hold_time * doubling_factor

    # L2
    second_week_time = first_week_time * doubling_factor

    # L3
    increase_percent_decimal = 0.5 # increased it by 50%
    third_week_increase = second_week_time * increase_percent_decimal

    # L4
    final_breath_hold_time = second_week_time + third_week_increase

    # FA
    answer = final_breath_hold_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: At the end of his first week, Brian now has doubled his initial time of {initial_breath_hold_time} seconds to {initial_breath_hold_time}*{doubling_factor}=<<{initial_breath_hold_time}*{doubling_factor}={first_week_time}>>{first_week_time} seconds

At the end of his second week, Brian doubled the previous week's time of {first_week_time} seconds to {first_week_time}*{doubling_factor}=<<{first_week_time}*{doubling_factor}={second_week_time}>>{second_week_time} seconds

At the end of his third week of practice, Brian adds another 50% of {second_week_time} seconds to his time so {second_week_time}*{increase_percent_decimal}= <<{second_week_time}*{increase_percent_decimal}={third_week_increase}>>{third_week_increase} seconds added

Having added {third_week_increase} seconds to his time from his second week, Brian can now hold his breath for {second_week_time}+{third_week_increase}= <<{third_week_increase}+{second_week_time}={final_breath_hold_time}>>{final_breath_hold_time} seconds

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: At the end of his second week, Brian doubled the previous week's time of 100 seconds to 100*2=<<100*2=200>>200 seconds

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'initial_breath_hold_time' (10) was used instead of 'doubling_factor' (2).
